announcements.title: App Update Available — Download New Version from LMS
announcements.message:
A new version of SciQuant Assistant is now available on the LMS.

**What's new:**
• You can now select a **secondary discipline** alongside your primary one — perfect for double majors! The AI tutor will tailor examples to both your fields.
• Bug fix: Notebook downloads now work correctly.

**How to update:**
1. Download the new ZIP from the LMS Downloads section
2. Replace your existing app with the new version
3. Your profile and settings will be preserved

If you haven't downloaded the app yet, just grab the latest version — no action needed.

announcements.title: Welcome to SCIE1500 Semester 1 2026!
announcements.message:
Welcome to Analytical Methods for Scientists! We're excited to have you join us this semester.

Before your first week:
• Download Miniconda (Python) for lab exercises — see Software section in Course Overview
• Review the course outline in the app
• Check your lab schedule — labs run on different days at different campuses
• Explore the SciQuant app features: AI tutor, weekly lessons, practice questions

Teaching starts Monday 23 February. See you soon!

announcements.title: Lab Schedule: Multiple Campus Options
announcements.message:
Labs are available at multiple times and campuses:

**Crawley Campus:**
• Monday 10am-12pm (ENCM 206)
• Monday 2pm-4pm (ENCM 206)
• Wednesday 1pm-3pm (ENCM 206)
• Thursday 2pm-4pm (ENCM 207A)

**Albany Campus:**
• Wednesday 9am-11am (ALBSCI 302/303)

Register for ONE lab session through StudentConnect. Labs begin Week 1 (24-28 Feb).

announcements.title: Labour Day: Monday 2 March — Labs Affected
announcements.message:
Monday 2 March is Labour Day (public holiday). Monday lab sessions are cancelled.

Students in Monday labs should attend a make-up session:
• Wednesday 1pm lab has capacity
• Or complete exercises independently and submit on time

Lab 1 submission remains due Tuesday 3 March at 11:59pm.

announcements.title: Assignment 1 Now Available on LMS
announcements.message:
Assignment 1 has been released on the LMS.

**Due:** Wednesday 1 April at 11:59 PM
**Weight:** 15%
**Covers:** Weeks 1-5 material

Start early! Details and submission portal are on the LMS.

Reminder: Assessment submissions are due at 11:59 PM (not 3:59 PM or 5:00 PM).

announcements.title: Mid-Semester Break: 6-10 April
announcements.message:
There are no lectures or labs during the mid-semester break (6-10 April).

This is a great time to:
• Review Weeks 1-6 material using the app's AI tutor
• Catch up on any incomplete practice questions
• Get ahead on reading for Act III (Weeks 7-10)

Note: Easter Monday (6 April) falls during the break. Classes resume Monday 14 April.

announcements.title: Anzac Day: Monday 27 April — Labs Affected
announcements.message:
Monday 27 April is Anzac Day (observed). Monday lab sessions are cancelled.

Students in Monday labs should attend a make-up session or complete exercises independently.

Lab 8 submission remains due Tuesday 28 April at 11:59pm.

announcements.title: Assignment 2 Now Available on LMS
announcements.message:
Assignment 2 has been released on the LMS.

**Due:** Tuesday 13 May at 11:59 PM
**Weight:** 15%
**Covers:** Weeks 7-10 material

Details and submission portal are on the LMS.

announcements.title: Lab 12 Extended Deadline: Tuesday 2 June
announcements.message:
Lab 12 (Week 12) has an extended submission deadline to avoid SWOTVAC.

**Due:** Tuesday 2 June at 11:59 PM (not Tuesday 26 May)

This is the only lab with a non-standard deadline. UWA policy prohibits assessment deadlines during SWOTVAC (25-29 May).

You'll have extra time to polish your final lab work before exams begin.

announcements.title: SWOTVAC: 25-29 May — Study Week
announcements.message:
SWOTVAC (Study WithOut Teaching VACation) runs 25-29 May.

• No lectures or labs
• No assessment deadlines (Lab 12 extended to 2 June)
• Use this week to prepare for exams
• AI tutor and all app resources remain available

Exam period: 30 May to 13 June

announcements.title: Final Exam: Centrally Scheduled
announcements.message:
The final exam will be scheduled by the UWA Examinations Office during the exam period (30 May — 13 June).

**Weight:** 50%
**Format:** Written examination
**Duration:** TBA

Exact date, time, and venue will be announced via:
• StudentConnect
• LMS
• Official UWA exam timetable

Scientific calculators permitted. Graphing/programmable calculators NOT permitted.

Check the LMS regularly for updates.
